DataElement.preferredName: Material Storage Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is an action of safekeeping harvested material in a repository or depository. EXAMPLE(S): refrigeration, cryopreservation, dehydration NOTE(S): There is a difference between the act of changing the state of material, which is represented here, and the act of maintaining state of the material by storing it. The period of time over which the activity is repeated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Material Storage Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Make or do or perform again.:The period of time during which something continues.

The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG 3.2 Release Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: Due to technical difficulties we are unable to correct a known error in the BRIDG model as loaded to caDSR. The association between DefinedMaterialStorage and Specimen is deprecated in BRIDG 3.2 and should not have been loaded to caDSR.

DataElement.changeDescription: Added BRIDG 3.2 Release Note as Association Reference Document. mc 5/15/13  Moved UML alt def to CDE preferred def and released per model owner approval. mc 6/2013
